intro: Phyllanthus parangoyensis, commonly known as the Parangoyensis spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with latex-producing properties. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
